channel.title: How do I PortForward?
channel.description:
Ok, I've went to No-IP.com and registered, made an account, added a hostname and made a no-ip.biz.
Now all I need to do I think is, portforward? (to make it online to others).
I went to portforward.com and I clicked 'Port Forwarding'. All that comes up are a list of websites. On the tutorial of portforwarding, it says select your routers model, which mine is NETGEAR.
Do I just go to NETGEAR.com or what?
If you can tell me how to portforward also, you'd be a great help :)
______________________________________________
Another thing which I'd rather do is to just make my server with my own computers IP adress. I'd rather do that, but I don't know how to. Any help please? :confused: :|
Like say my computers IP address was 82.911.29.19 how would I make that so others would just type that in and log into my server?
Another thing, when I runserver, I can only access my server with the IP 0.0.0.0 and the port 5555, is this normal? _______________________________________________
How do I find out my port of my server?
Is it when you run the server, it says 0.0.0.0:5555 . . is it the 5555?[br][size=1]Posted on: August 10, 2007, 11:18:48 AM[/size][hr]Can no one please help? I would appreciate it so much, I just want to run my own server, let others have fun, etc.

item.title: How do I PortForward?
item.dc:creator: @Steviie Steviie
item.description:
@Steviie wrote:

i’ve did exactlly this:

Service Name = EyreScape2K7
Service Type = TCP
Starting Port = 43594
Ending Port = 43594
Server IP Address = (the ip)

Service Name = EyreScape2K6
Service Type = UDP
Starting Port = 43594
Ending Port = 43594
Server IP Address = (the ip )

just wondering what i do once i’ve did this

Read full topic

item.title: How do I PortForward?
item.dc:creator: @treston323 treston323
item.description:
@treston323 wrote:

ok, im at pfconfig and did all the stuff but i didnt get when you said --line back in the Command Prompt (in IPCONFIG). Now instead of portforwarding the ports for that program (Port 25), portforward the port that your server is going to use. Most servers use the port 43594, so if you want to port-forward that, then go ahead. If the source you’re going to download soon doesn’t, we’ll change it so it does.

Read full topic

item.title: How do I PortForward?
item.dc:creator: @toonshorty toonshorty
item.description:
@toonshorty wrote:

ok…

you will have to do it twice…

protocol: TCP
service name: //dunno (leave blank!)
service type: HTTP
Service Port: 43594 (or watever port you want)
Ending Port: same as Service Port
Server IP: your IP address 192.168..**

protocol: UDP
Service Name: Leave blank
Service Type: FTP
starting port: 43594 (or whatever port you want your server to be)
ending port: same as starting port
server IP: your IP address

oh and make sure the IP is your computer…

mine is 192.168.1.171

Read full topic
